div.p: This opetional element is found in WRITING PRODUCTION PMATERIALCONDITIONS . It applies to information about women who wrote from a displaced position (geographical or physical in some sense). It has one possible value (apart from Unspecified): DisplacementYes.

div.codeblock: <PMATERIALCONDITIONS DISPLACEMENT="displacementyes">When Margaret Laurence followed her then-husband to <PLACE><GEOG>Africa</GEOG></PLACE>; the imposed exile from <PLACE><GEOG>Canada</GEOG></PLACE>, followed by an extended residence in <PLACE><GEOG>England </GEOG></PLACE>, stirred her desire to write.</PMATERIALCONDITIONS>

<PMATERIALCONDITIONSDISPLACEMENT=''displacementyes">After her outrageous behaviour in the winter of 1922, Sally Jones Wemyss-Smith was banished to her parents’ country house, never to see London again. There she began on her next book.</PMATERIALCONDITIONS>

div.p: Keep in mind that this is a material condition, not a psychological or imaginary one. This applies only to physical and/or geographical displacement. Also it’s about conditions for writing MIGRATION or displacement as life events go in the BIOGRAPHY section, in LOCATION.
Question: What if the woman writer felt psychologically displaced from her community? Do I discuss it here?
Answer: No. This attribute does not apply to psychological states.
